instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
Defective <CAPACITOR>C7420</CAPACITOR> (burst) on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> was exchanged.
During the test HWMonitor Mainboard shows 128 Â° C (possibly no sensor?)

ALS does not work
The system hangs, windows close by themselves. PRAM reset (3x) and SMC reset do not help
Could use some help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: The machine works good disconnecting webcam?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
Hello 2informaticos, it's now me working on this machine (ntcR is a work colleague from me).

Disconnecting webcam means disconnecting the display (LVDS)?
Or is there another connector only for the cam?
The machine runs now for 1/2 hour without problems over ext. HDMI

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
The webcam connector is on T-CON, in the LCD assembly; the smallest connector.
Disconnecting LCD from MLB and using external monitor, also disconnects ALS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
ok, the machine runs now 1,5h without any problem. Before, the longest time was ca. 40 minutes.
What does that mean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: As I said, reconnect internal monitor and disconnect only webcam from T-CON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: It's running now more than 4.5h without any problem - with only webcam disconnected from T-CON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
Then is ALS issue.
You can try removing <RESISTOR>R8556</RESISTOR>/58, but camera may not work anymore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: I removed <RESISTOR>R8556</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R8558</RESISTOR>, but the camera is still running.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: If camera still works and ALS problem disappeared, that's good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: ALS don't work. I am now testing whether the crash problems still exist.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message: ALS doesn't work, of course; that's the reason to remove <RESISTOR>R8556</RESISTOR>/58.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
Yes of course, mistake in my thinking. btw the machine is running without problems. Many thanks for your help - great.

Only for better understanding - can you explain to me what happens with such an ALS error? Is the Sensor talking bullshit on the I2C? Why is the machine randomly crashing? (Only if you have a bit time left)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-01 ALS dont work
threads.message:
Somehow, ALS screws the I2C bus communication.
And SMC cannot read the other sensors connected to an interface from the same bus.
